movies.title: Outpost
movies.plot: In a seedy bar in a town ravaged by war, mysterious businessman Hunt hires ex-marine D.C. to assemble a crack team of ex-soldiers to protect him on a dangerous journey into no-man's land. To this gang of hardened warriors, battle-worn veterans and borderline criminals killing is just a job - and one they enjoy. Their mission - to scope out an old military bunker. It should be easy - 48 hours at the most. Lots of cash for little risk, or so he says. Once at the outpost, the men make a horrific discovery that turns their mission on its head - the scene of a bloody and gruesome series of experiments, carried out by the Nazis on their own soldiers during WWII. Amid the carnage, they find something even more disturbing - someone who's still alive. As war rages above ground, and a mysterious enemy emerges from the darkness below, D.C. and his men find themselves trapped in a claustrophobic and terrifying scenario. Their mission is no longer one of safe-guarding - it's one of survival. ...
movies.simplePlot: In war-torn Eastern Europe, a world-weary group of mercenaries discover a long-hidden secret in an abandoned WWII bunker.

biography.bio: Tall, dark, but somewhat gentle-looking actor Ray Stevenson was born in Lisburn, Northern Ireland on 25 May 1964, on a British army base. His father was a British pilot in the Royal Air Force, and his mother is Irish. He moved with his family to Lemington, Newcastle-Upon-Tyne, England in 1972 at the age of eight, and later to Cramlington, Northumberland, where he was raised. As a child, he dreamed to become an actor, but he also thought that dream was impossible. So he pursued his other love, art, and went to art school instead. He was an interior designer with an architectural firm in London when he at 25 decided to try out acting. Eventually he attended Bristol Old Vic Theatre School, graduating at the age of 29. At the beginning of 90s, he began his career on films. He did a few TV films, one of them is The Return of the Native (1994), where he appeared opposite Clive Owen, Catherine Zeta-Jones and Steven Mackintosh. He also filmed The Theory of Flight (1998) Greenwich Mean Time (1999), Green-Eyed Monster (2001) (TV) and a lot of TV guest roles in series. Finally, he made a international breakout with King Arthur (2004), as quiet, but loyal knight Dagonet, again with Clive Owen (who played Arthur), Keira Knightley, Ioan Gruffudd, Mads Mikkelsen, Ray Winstone and Stellan Skarsgard. After a few more TV films, Stevenson's popularity started to rise by each film. But, his real fame came with HBO's "Rome" (2005 - 2007), as funny, but heroically fearless legionary Titus Pullo, opposite Kevin McKidd. Another two well-known roles were in the action horror Outpost (2008) and as comic book dark hero The Punisher / Frank Castle in the extremely violent Punisher: War Zone (2008), opposite Dominic West (Jigsaw), Doug Hutchison, Colin Salmon, Wayne Knight (Microchip), Dash Mihok (Det. Marin Soap) and Julie Benz. Stevenson also worked on the stage where he played the part of Christ in the York Mystery Plays in 2000 at York Minster. In 2001, he took the part of Roger in the play Mouth to Mouth by Kevin Elyot, at the Albery Theatre in London with Lindsay Duncan and Michael Maloney. His most well-known part is perhaps that of the Cardinal in The Duchess of Malfi by John Webster with Janet McTeer at the Royal National Theatre in 2003. Ray was married to actress Ruth Gemmell from 1997 to 2005. His girlfriend Elisabetta Caraccia have a son, Sebastiano Derek Stevenson, who was born in 2007. Besides acting, he loves art and has a passion for water color painting.
biography.name: Ray Stevenson

biography.bio: Julian Wadham was born on August 7, 1958 in Ware, Hertfordshire, England as Julian Neil Rohan Wadham. He is an actor, known for The English Patient (1996), Exorcist: The Beginning (2004) and Outpost (2008). He was previously married to Shirley Cassedy.
biography.name: Julian Wadham

biography.bio: Richard Brake was born on November 30, 1964 in Ystrad Mynach, Hengoed, Wales as Richard Colin Brake. He is an actor, known for Batman Begins (2005), Spy (2015) and Thor: The Dark World (2013).
biography.name: Richard Brake

biography.bio: Paul Blair is an actor, known for Outpost (2008), Hallam Foe (2007) and Book of Blood (2009).
biography.name: Paul Blair

biography.bio: Brett Fancy is a British child of the 60's, the son of a Portsmouth Dockyard worker and a homemaker. A gold medal winner at the Guildhall School of Music and Drama in London, Brett's professional career as an actor spans several decades of work. He is best known for his television roles in Rockliffe's Babies, Square Deal, and Resort to Murder and he has also appeared in guest roles in a wide range of popular prime time British TV shows, including Luther, New Tricks, Silent Witness, EastEnders, Judge John Deed, and Jonathan Creek, among others. Brett's first film role was a scene with Charlton Heston in Treasure Island (1990) with Pete Postlethwaite and a young Christian Bale. His first major film role came with the part of Taktarov, a battle-worn Russian mercenary in the horror film Outpost (2008) alongside Ray Stevenson. Brett, played the hero fireman Paul in Lost Christmas (2011), opposite Jason Flemyng starring Eddie Izzard. In the horror comedy feature film Kill Me Now (2012) Brett stars alongside Michael Swaim, Kyle Mooney and Beck Bennett as the 'Driller Killer', a serial killer who seeks revenge against the idleness of the American teenager. Films due out in 2016 include UNTITLED (a Film) (2015) Arifa (2017) and 'Augmented'. His theatre credits include three shows at the Royal National Theatre, with performances in Single Spies alongside Alan Bennett, Simon Callow and Prunella Scales; 'Antony and Cleopatra' starring Alan Rickman,Helen Mirren and Samuel West; and as 'Eilif' opposite Diana Rigg and Lesley Sharp in 'Mother Courage'. Versatile and adaptable, Brett has played his fair share of both heroes and villains, and brings insight, originality and sensitivity to every persona that he portrays. A consummate professional, he continues to expand his portfolio within the UK and USA. When he's not working, Brett splits his time between his home in London, and Brighton, where his two adult sons live. He is also an advanced scuba diver and experienced snowboarder, and is experienced in stage combat.
biography.name: Brett Fancy

biography.bio: Enoch Frost is of Ghanaian heritage & was born in Balham, London. he lived in a south London children's home until he was adopted by English parents when he was 7 years old. He grew up in Somerset with his adoptive family who were avid Theatre goers and had several relatives who were successful actors. These included the late Sir Donald Sinden who encouraged Enoch to pursue a career in drama after watching him in a secondary school play. Upon Graduation from the Guildford School of Acting, he spent time pursuing his love of snowboarding in the French alps before moving to Australia for a year to study full time at a Kung Fu academy in Adelaide. His adoptive father also took him back to Ghana to reunite with his biological family. He is a fan of Rally and Formula One and lives in England with his partner and their daughter Quincy.
biography.name: Enoch Frost

biography.bio: Julian Rivett was born in 1967 in Eastbourne, East Sussex, England as Julian Illya Rivett. He is an actor, known for Outpost (2008), I Want You (1998) and To Kill a King (2003).
biography.name: Julian Rivett

biography.bio: Michael Smiley was born in 1963 in Belfast, Northern Ireland. He is an actor, known for Le parfum - Histoire d'un meurtrier (2006), The World's End (2013) and Kill List (2011). He is married to Miranda Sawyer. They have one child.
biography.name: Michael Smiley

biography.bio: Johnny Meres was born on December 3, 1958 in Nottingham, Nottinghamshire, England. He is an actor and writer, known for Outpost (2008), Le petit vampire (2000) and Outpost: Black Sun (2012).
biography.name: Johnny Meres

biography.bio: Xuki Robeli is an actress, known for Outpost (2008).
biography.name: Xuki Robeli

biography.bio: Mark Smith is an actor, known for Outpost (2008), Secrets of the Content (2010) and Department 5: Prologue (2009).
biography.name: Mark Smith

biography.bio: Graeme Temple is an actor, known for Outpost (2008).
biography.name: Graeme Temple

biography.bio: Charlie Jeffrey is an actor, known for Outpost (2008) and The Day Hitler Died (2016).
biography.name: Charlie Jeffrey

biography.bio: Fergus Johnston is an actor and writer, known for Outpost (2008), What Would Ridley Do? (2011) and Scots in Translation (2012).
biography.name: Fergus Johnston

biography.bio: Actor Matt McClure was born in Glasgow, Scotland. He played Johnny in "The Wee Man', the biopic of Glasgow gangster Paul Ferris. The film, directed by Ray Burdis, won Best Film at the BAFTA (Scotland) Awards voted by Cineworld Audiences. He will soon be seen as Count Moray in the lead cast of 'Queens' (Reinas) - the 6 part mini series on the life of Mary Queen of Scots. Matt's theatre work includes the critically acclaimed and award winning 'Black Watch' directed by John Tiffany for National Theatre Scotland and David Greig's 'Dunsinane' for The Royal Shakespeare Company.
biography.name: Matt McClure
